entries.description: This circular hoop has blades along its outer edge. You can wield it in two hands (using the two-hand damage) or by spinning it around an arm. While you spin the hoop, it gains the free-hand trait. Setting the hoop spinning takes 1 Interact action. In addition to the normal restrictions of the free-hand trait, extended use of the arm for locomotion (such as to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.pprgrYQ1QnIDGZiy]{Climb}) interferes with the hoop's spinning and forces you to Release the hoop. You can't spin a hoop underwater. Keeping the hoop spinning requires a free action each round, which has the concentrate and manipulate traits. You can keep a hoop spinning as an exploration activity, but doing so for more than 10 minutes makes you fatigued, similarly to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JuqmIAnkL9hVGai8]{Hustle}.

entries.name: Bladed Scarf
entries.description: The thin metal plates interwoven throughout this long scarf turn a fashion accessory into a deadly weapon.

entries.name: Blast Boots (Greater)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

These sets of rockets come in pairs and strap onto existing footwear (or a creature's feet). Inserting them and aligning them properly takes 1 minute. When you Activate the greater blast boots to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}, you can increase the vertical distance of your High Jump by up to 50 feet. When you Activate them to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, you can increase the horizontal distance of your Long Jump by up to 75 feet. Additionally, for 1 minute, the greater blast boots continue to boost your jumps. Every time you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} during the duration, you can move 30 feet in any direction, or your normal Leap distance, whichever is further.

entries.name: Blast Boots (Lesser)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

These sets of rockets come in pairs and strap onto existing footwear (or a creature's feet). Inserting them and aligning them properly takes 1 minute. When you Activate the blast boots, you can @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, without the need to Stride first.

entries.name: Blast Boots (Major)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

These sets of rockets come in pairs and strap onto existing footwear (or a creature's feet). Inserting them and aligning them properly takes 1 minute. When you Activate the major blast boots to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}, you can increase the vertical distance of your High Jump by up to 80 feet. When you Activate them to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, you can increase the horizontal distance of your Long Jump by up to 120 feet. Additionally, for 1 minute, the major blast boots remain active, allowing you to clumsily fly through the air for the duration. You gain a 30-foot Fly speed for the duration, but any time you @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.cS9nfDRGD83bNU1p]{Fly}, you are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Blast Boots (Moderate)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

These sets of rockets come in pairs and strap onto existing footwear (or a creature's feet). Inserting them and aligning them properly takes 1 minute. When you Activate the moderate blast boots to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump}, you can increase the vertical distance of your High Jump by up to 30 feet. When you Activate them to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump}, you can increase the horizontal distance of your Long Jump by up to 45 feet.

entries.name: Blast Foot
entries.description:
These prosthetic feet and legs, created by dwarven alchemists and spellcasters together, are engraved with simple but effective evocation symbols on the ball and heel, empowering you to leap to great heights and blast foes with your feet.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per 10 minutes

Effect You blast off from the ground, using the force to leap through the air. The blast feet cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump} on you.

Activate 2 envision, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You blast from your feet, dealing [[/r {4d6}[force]]]{4d6 force damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:15], with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:22|basic:true|traits:evocation,magical] save.

entries.name: Blast Foot (Greater)
entries.description:
These prosthetic feet and legs, created by dwarven alchemists and spellcasters together, are engraved with simple but effective evocation symbols on the ball and heel, empowering you to leap to great heights and blast foes with your feet.

Activate 1 envision

Frequency once per minute

Effect You blast off from the ground, using the force to leap through the air. The blast feet cast @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Q7QQ91vQtyi1Ux36]{Jump} on you.

Activate 2 envision, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You blast from your feet, dealing [[/r {8d6}[force]]]{8d6 force damage} to all creatures in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], with a @Check[type:reflex|dc:27|basic:true|name:Blast Foot|traits:evocation,magical] save.

entries.name: Blaze
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This acrid blend of black powder, honey, saltpeter, sulfur, and stranger ingredients sees plenty of use in the Mana Wastes, where magical environmental protection is unreliable. Users experience euphoric feelings of warmth and wellbeing followed by intense bouts of dehydration and disorientation.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 +1 item bonus to saves versus fire effects, and you treat severe or extreme environmental heat effects as if they were one step lower (1 hour)

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.VlfuBfWkygsG8u5h]{Effect: Blaze}

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}, and you treat severe or extreme environmental heat effects as if they were one step lower (1 hour);

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} (1 hour)

entries.name: Blazons of Shared Power
entries.description: These brass emblems come in a variety of designs, usually customized to the purchaser to reflect the heraldry of a family or guild. Blazons of shared power come in sets of three. When you invest the blazons, you wear one of the three on your chest, and you attach the others to a pair of one-handed weapons, choosing one as the primary weapon and one as the secondary weapon. These weapons can be either melee weapons or ranged weapons. As long as you're wielding both the primary weapon and the secondary weapon, the secondary weapon gains the benefit of the fundamental runes on the primary weapon. A weapon can only have a single blazon of shared power attached to it at a time.

entries.name: Blazons of Shared Power (Greater)
entries.description:
These brass emblems come in a variety of designs, usually customized to the purchaser to reflect the heraldry of a family or guild. Blazons of shared power come in sets of three. When you invest the blazons, you wear one of the three on your chest, and you attach the others to a pair of one-handed weapons, choosing one as the primary weapon and one as the secondary weapon. These weapons can be either melee weapons or ranged weapons. As long as you're wielding both the primary weapon and the secondary weapon, the secondary weapon gains the benefit of the fundamental runes on the primary weapon. A weapon can only have a single blazon of shared power attached to it at a time.

A set of greater blazons of shared power also replicates property runes from the primary weapon, so long as the secondary weapon meets all the prerequisites for a given rune and isn't a specific weapon. The secondary weapon gains the benefits of those runes. All of its own runes are suppressed. When you invest the blazons, you can elect for them to transfer only fundamental runes, in which case they function as standard blazons of shared power.

entries.name: Bleeding Spines Snare
entries.description: When a creature enters the square, spines covered in numerous jagged thorns protrude out to stab it, dealing 8d8 piercing damage and @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed2d8.success]. The creature must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true] saving throw. After the initial trigger, the spines retract and protrude again repeatedly for 1 minute, forcing any creature that enters the space or ends its turn in the space to attempt a Reflex save against the spines' damage.

entries.name: Blessed Ampoule
entries.description:
Activate f envision

Trigger Your Strike with the affixed weapon hits a target

Requirements You're an expert with the affixed weapon.

This small glass vial contains a drop of holy water. When activated, the weapon's physical damage for the Strike becomes good damage.

entries.name: Blessed Tattoo
entries.description:
Activate D envision, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain the effect of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.gMODOGamz88rgHuf]{Protection} against evil.

You can activate the tattoo as a reaction instead of a two-action activity, triggered when a demon attacks you or you attempt a saving throw against a demon's ability.

entries.name: Blight Bomb (Greater)
entries.description:
Usage held in 1 hand

Activate A Strike

Blight bombs contain volatile toxic chemicals that rot flesh. A blight bomb deals 3d6 poison damage, 3d4 persistent poison damage, and 3 poison splash damage. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: Blight Bomb (Lesser)
entries.description:
Usage held in 1 hand

Activate A Strike

Blight bombs contain volatile toxic chemicals that rot flesh. A blight bomb deals 1d6 poison damage, 1d4 persistent poison damage, and 1 poison splash damage.

entries.name: Blight Bomb (Major)
entries.description:
Usage held in 1 hand

Activate A Strike

Blight bombs contain volatile toxic chemicals that rot flesh. A blight bomb deals 4d6 poison damage, 4d4 persistent poison damage, and 4 poison splash damage. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: Blight Bomb (Moderate)
entries.description:
Usage held in 1 hand

Activate A Strike

Blight bombs contain volatile toxic chemicals that rot flesh. A blight bomb deals 2d6 poison damage, 2d4 persistent poison damage, and 2 poison splash damage. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: Blightburn Necklace
entries.description: This heavy iron necklace is decorated with tiny gems that resemble the stars in the ceiling high above the Vault of the Black Desert. While you have invested this item, you cannot contract blightburn sickness. It doesn't cure blightburn sickness if you already have it, but the disease's stage can't progress while you wear it.

entries.name: Blightburn Resin
entries.description:
This tacky, hardened sap is harvested from trees infected by fungal blights and exposed to open flames.

Activate A Interact (Contact)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31]

Onset 1 minute

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {8d6}[poison]]]{8d6 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {10d6}[poison]]]{10d6 poison damage} (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {15d6}[poison]]]{15d6 poison damage} (1 round)

entries.name: Blightburn Sickness
entries.description:
Creatures native to the Black Desert are immune, as are creatures who are affected by blightburn sickness but recover from it. The target can't recover from the disease's @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained} or @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition except by magic.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:32|traits:disease]

Onset [[/br 1d4 #days]]{1d4 days}

Stage 1 drained 1 (1 day)

Stage 2 drained 1 and sickened 1 (1 day)

Stage 3 drained 2 and sickened 2 (1 week)

Stage 4 drained 3 and sickened 3 (1 month)

Stage 5 increase drained condition by 1 (1 year)

entries.name: Blightburn Ward
entries.description: This heavy iron necklace is decorated with tiny gems that resemble the stars in the ceiling high above the Vault of the Black Desert. While you have invested this item, you cannot contract blightburn sickness. It doesn't cure blightburn sickness if you already have it, but the disease's stage can't progress while you wear it.

entries.name: Blindpepper Bolt
entries.description:
Ammunition bolt

Activate 1 Interact

The head of this bolt is a vented container that smells strongly of caustic pepper. When an activated blindpepper bolt hits a target, it deals no damage; instead the creature must attempt a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17|showDC:all] save. If the Strike was a critical success, the target takes a -2 circumstance penalty to its Fortitude save. At the GM's discretion, a creature with no eyes or olfactory organs might not be affected by this item.

Critical Success The target is unaffected.

Success The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} until the end of your next turn. It can end the effect early if it spends an action, which has the manipulate trait, to wipe down its eyes.

Failure The target is dazzled for 1 minute.

Critical Failure The target is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} until the end of your next turn and dazzled for 1 minute.

entries.name: Blindpepper Bomb
entries.description:
Activate 1 Strike

Though expensive, these single-use alchemical bombs are often used by police forces to disperse unruly crowds and quell riots without risking permanent physical injury to either officers or civilians.

The bomb can be thrown up to 30 feet, causing it to explode, spraying the aerosolized pepper dust in a 15-foot-radius burst. All creatures in the area must succeed at a @Check[type:reflex|dc:18|showDC:all] save to avoid inhaling the dust or getting it in their eyes.

On a failed save, the creature is @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round and then @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} for 1 round.

On a critical failure, the creature is blinded for 1 round, @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}, and dazzled until it removes the sickened condition.

entries.name: Blindpepper Tube
entries.description: This single-use pacification device consists of finely ground hot pepper loaded into a sealed, blowgun-style tube with a one-way valve and a range of 5 feet. To use it, the wielder must tear open the tube's seal as an Interact action, then spend another action to blow the hot pepper into an adjacent creature's face. These actions don't have to be taken in the same round. The target must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:15] save to avoid inhaling the pepper or getting it in their eyes. On a failed save, the creature is blinded for 1 round and then dazzled for 1 round. On a critical failure, the creature is blinded for 1 round, sickened 1, and dazzled until it removes the sickened condition.

entries.name: Blocks
entries.description: These wooden blocks can be stacked to build flimsy structures. A standard set comes in a small sack with 12 blocks.

entries.name: Blood Sap
entries.description:
This potent drug is distilled from a certain tropical vine into a deep-red syrup that, over time, stains the user's lips and teeth a vivid shade of red.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:16]

Onset 10 minutes

Maximum Duration 3 hours

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}, +1 item bonus to weapon and unarmed attack rolls, Acrobatics checks, and Athletics checks (10 minutes)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.xYTAsEpcJE1Ccni3]{Slowed 1} (1 hour)

entries.name: Bloodbane
entries.description:
A bloodbane clan dagger is especially vicious against the ancestral enemies of the clan. When you damage an appropriate type of creature with the weapon, that creature takes [[/r {1}[persistent,bleed]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}. The type of creature depends on the clan that made the dagger, but is typically drow, duergar, giant, or orc.

In addition, whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with a bloodbane weapon (whether from its innate ability or in some other way), the weapon leaves ragged wounds. The bleeding creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:25] save or become sickened 1. The creature is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

entries.name: Bloodbane (Greater)
entries.description:
A bloodbane clan dagger is especially vicious against the ancestral enemies of the clan. When you damage an appropriate type of creature with the weapon, that creature takes @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d4.success]. The type of creature depends on the clan that made the dagger, but is typically drow, duergar, giant, or orc.

In addition, whenever you inflict persistent bleed damage with a bloodbane weapon (whether from its innate ability or in some other way), the weapon leaves ragged wounds. The bleeding creature must succeed at a @Check[type:fortitude|dc:30|name:Greater Bloodbane] save or become sickened 1. The creature is then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

entries.name: Bloodeye Coffee
entries.description:
A strong blend including several spices common in the Padishah Empire of Kelesh, bloodeye coffee is a favorite morning drink across the Inner Sea region. The maximum addiction stage of bloodeye coffee never progresses beyond stage 1.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:14]

Onset 10 minutes

Maximum Duration 8 hours

Stage 1 +1 item bonus to AC and saves to which you are taking penalties caused by the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} condition (10 minutes)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} (1 hour)

Stage 3 can't recover from fatigued (1 day, after which the drug ends)

entries.name: Bloodhound Mask (Greater)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

Duration 8 hours

This wide, single-use mask is designed to be slipped over your mouth and nose and its alchemical filter activated all with one hand. Once activated, the mask sharpens odors, giving you imprecise scent with a 60 foot range. You can't wear other masks while you're wearing a bloodhound mask.

When you use Survival to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} a creature by its scent, your proficiency bonus is equal to your level even if you're untrained, and the mask grants you a +3 item bonus to your Survival check. The GM sets the Survival DC based on the area's ability to hold scent rather than on visual clues, as normal for using scent.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.MI5OCkF9IXmD2lPF]{Effect: Bloodhound Mask (Greater)}

entries.name: Bloodhound Mask (Lesser)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

Duration 10 minutes

This wide, single-use mask is designed to be slipped over your mouth and nose and its alchemical filter activated all with one hand. Once activated, the mask sharpens odors, giving you imprecise scent with a 15 foot range. You can't wear other masks while you're wearing a bloodhound mask.

When you use Survival to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} a creature by its scent, your proficiency bonus is equal to your level even if you're untrained, and the mask grants you a +1 item bonus to your Survival check. The GM sets the Survival DC based on the area's ability to hold scent rather than on visual clues, as normal for using scent.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.S4MZzALqFoXJsr6o]{Effect: Bloodhound Mask (Lesser)}

entries.name: Bloodhound Mask (Moderate)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

Duration 1 hour

This wide, single-use mask is designed to be slipped over your mouth and nose and its alchemical filter activated all with one hand. Once activated, the mask sharpens odors, giving you imprecise scent a 30 foot range. You can't wear other masks while you're wearing a bloodhound mask.

When you use Survival to @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} a creature by its scent, your proficiency bonus is equal to your level even if you're untrained, and the mask grants you a +2 item bonus to your Survival check. The GM sets the Survival DC based on the area's ability to hold scent rather than on visual clues, as normal for using scent.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.wFF0SZs1Hcf87Kk1]{Effect: Bloodhound Mask (Moderate)}

entries.name: Bloodletting Kukri
entries.description: This +1 striking kukri has a crimson blade that shimmers eerily in bright light. On a critical hit, the kukri deals @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d8.success]. If the target didn't already have persistent bleed damage when you scored the critical hit, you also gain 1d8 temporary Hit Points.

entries.name: Bloodseeker Beak
entries.description:
This long, hollow proboscis is harvested from the notorious bloodseeker beast and drips a trickle of blood.

Usage affixed to a weapon

Activate F Envision

Trigger You hit a flat-footed creature with the affixed weapon

When you activate the beak, you deal an extra 1d4 precision damage on your damage roll. If you deal sneak attack damage to the creature, you also deal @Localize[PF2E.PersistentDamage.Bleed1d4.success].

entries.name: Bloodthirsty
entries.description:
Usage etched onto a slashing or piercing melee weapon

The magic in this rune sings in time with your attacks and coaxes you into finishing your opponent. When you critically hit a target that's taking persistent bleed damage, your target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1}.

Activate r envision

Trigger You reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with the weapon

Effect You gain a number of temporary Hit Points equal to twice the creature's level. These Hit Points remain for 1 minute.

entries.name: Blowgun
entries.description: This long, narrow tube is used for shooting blowgun darts, using only the power of a forcefully exhaled breath.

entries.name: Blowgun Darts
entries.description: These thin, light darts are typically made of hardwood and stabilized with fletching of down or fur. They are often hollow so they can be used to deliver poison.

entries.name: Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Adult)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a blue dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a blue dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of electricity which deals [[/r {6d6}[electricity]]]{6d6 electricity damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true|name:Adult Blue Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Wyrm)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a blue dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a blue dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of electricity which deals [[/r {10d6}[electricity]]]{10d6 electricity damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true|name:Wyrm Blue Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Blue Dragon's Breath Potion (Young)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a blue dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a blue dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of electricity which deals [[/r {4d6}[electricity]]]{4d6 electricity damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true|name:Young Blue Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Blue Dragonfly Poison
entries.description:
Boggards brew a potent toxin made from blue dragonflies. Swampseers consume this mixture to awaken their divine powers, but the poison inspires crippling hallucinations in most other creatures.

Activate A Interact (Ingested)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Onset 10 minutes

Maximum Duration 30 minutes

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} (10 minutes)

Stage 2 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TkIyaNPgTZFBCCuh]{Dazzled} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} (10 minutes)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.yblD8fOR1J8rDwEQ]{Confused} (1 minute)

entries.name: Blueblisters
entries.description:
This flesh-eating disease causes prominent and painful blue blisters on the skin and gums. You can't reduce your sickened condition while afflicted with blueblisters.

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:17]

Onset 1 day

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1} (1 day)

Stage 2 sickened 1 and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.4D2KBtexWXa6oUMR]{Drained 1} (1 day)

Stage 3 sickened 2 and drained 1 (1 week)

Stage 4 sickened 2 and drained 2 (1 week)

entries.name: Blunderbuss
entries.description: This weapon fires pellets from a trumpet-shaped barrel, making it an excellent choice for hunting brush fowl or dealing damage within a short, broad area. Adventuring gunslingers often carry a blunderbuss to deal with swarms of vermin and similar threats.

entries.name: Bo Staff
entries.description: This strong but slender staff is tapered at the ends and well balanced. It's designed to be an offensive and defensive weapon.

entries.name: Boarding Axe
entries.description: This small axe sports a spike opposite the blade that aids in climbing and is useful in clearing obstacles, such as fallen rigging.

entries.name: Boarding Pike
entries.description: Taking the form of a longspear fitted with crossbars or hooks, a boarding pike provides its wielder a sharp implement that's as adept at shoving enemies off a ship's railings as facilitating the boarding of other vessels. This is a martial melee weapon.

entries.name: Boastful Hunter
entries.description:
Perception +11; precise vision 30 feet, imprecise hearing 30 feet

Communication speech (Common)

Skills Nature +9, Performance +10, Survival +11

Int +0, Wis +2, Cha +3

Will +11

Possessing a boisterous, proud demeanor, this +1 jezail is an aspiring big game hunter, always quick to share a tale of its bold adventures and predatory conquests-although the veracity of such tales is often questionable. A boastful hunter enjoys tracking and hunting animals of all kinds but takes particular pleasure in taking down large, dangerous, or rare animals. Against an animal, the boastful hunter deals [[/r {1d6}[additional]]]{1d6 additional damage}. On a critical hit against an animal, the boastful hunter also deals [[/r {1d6}[persistent,bleed]]]{1d6} @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.

A boastful hunter urges you to face off against tougher and tougher creatures-a challenge the ambitious rifle may not be adequate to deal with. If the boastful hunter goes one week without participating in a hunt against an animal of at least your level, it becomes bored. A bored boastful hunter complains incessantly and imposes a -1 item penalty to attack rolls against non-animal targets. A bored boastful hunter can be appeased by using it in combat against an animal of at least your level.

Unable to accept its own weaknesses, a boastful hunter blames any failed hunts on you, and considers remarks about its strength or quality a terrible insult. An insulted boastful hunter badmouths you to sentient creatures you interact with, imposing a -1 item penalty to Deception, Diplomacy, and Intimidation skill checks, and all attacks with it incur a misfire chance until the weapon is appeased. An insulted boastful hunter can be appeased by complimenting it and succeeding at a @Check[type:diplomacy|dc:21|name:Boastful Hunter Appeasement] check against its Will DC two days in a row. You can only attempt a Diplomacy check to appease the boastful hunter once each day.

entries.name: Body Recovery Kit
entries.description:
This small silver tin is filled with a herb-infused salve and a shroud of fine silk fabric. The salve smells of lavender and hyssop and is waxy to the touch. The shroud, made of spun silk, can a hold a Medium or smaller creature.

If you apply the salve and shroud to a creature that died within the past 3 days, a process which normally takes 1 hour, it slows the decomposition process, allowing a creature to be brought back to life with @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.IkGYwHRLhkuoGReG]{Raise Dead} up to 1 week after its death.

entries.name: Bola
entries.description: This throwing weapon consists of weights tied to the end of long cords, which can be used to bludgeon foes or entangle their legs.

entries.name: Bolts
entries.description: Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

entries.name: Bomb Launcher
entries.description: This long, hollow tube is held in two hands and braced over the shoulder. Inside, it contains a small metal basket sized to hold alchemical bombs. A chute in the top delivers an alchemical bomb into the internal basket, while a lever on the underside pulls the basket back and locks it in place. Loading an alchemical bomb into a bomb launcher requires a single Interact action. With a pull of a trigger, the basket speeds forward, allowing you to Strike with the loaded alchemical bomb over long distances. Bombs fired with a bomb launcher have a range increment of 60 feet.

entries.name: Bomb Snare
entries.description:
You create a snare that catalyzes three 3rd-level moderate alchemical bombs of the same type to explode when a creature enters the snare's square. The target and all creatures in adjacent squares must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:26|basic:true|showDC:all], as the snare deals damage equal to three times the direct hit damage from one of the component bombs (for example, [[/r {6d6}[electricity]]]{6d6 electricity damage} from bottled lightning) with no splash damage or other effects.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The creature takes half damage and no other effects.

Failure The creature takes full damage. It also takes all other effects of a direct hit from one of the component bombs (such as flat-footed from bottled lightning or persistent damage from an acid flask).

Critical Failure The creature takes double damage, plus all other effects of a direct hit (as failure).

Craft Requirements Supply three of the same damaging 3rd-level moderate alchemical bomb.

entries.name: Bomber's Eye Elixir (Greater)
entries.description:
Activate A Interact

This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover by 2.

entries.name: Bomber's Eye Elixir (Lesser)
entries.description:
Activate A Interact

This tincture lets you pinpoint your foes. For the next 5 minutes, your alchemical bomb Strikes reduce the circumstance bonus to AC your targets gain from cover by 1.

entries.name: Bomber's Saddle
entries.description:
Developed by urdefhans for their skaveling mounts but quickly copied by other races' cavalry, this leather saddle is made from cave worm hide and is designed to fit a variety of flying steeds. In addition to a seat for the rider, the bomber's saddle has a bomb compartment situated underneath the mount.

The compartment can hold up to six alchemical bombs of light or negligible Bulk.

Activate A Interact

Effect You drop a single item from the saddle's compartment, which falls to the ground below. If the item is a bomb, make a ranged Strike with it.

Activate D Interact

Requirements The saddle's compartment is loaded with two to six bombs

Effect You drop the saddle's entire payload, scattering the bombs below. Make a single ranged Strike against an AC of 10. The AC increases by 1 for every 5 feet above the target area you are.

On a failure, the bombs fly away wildly and deal no damage.

On a successful attack roll, the bombs fall and shatter, starting in the target area and moving in a line of 5-foot spaces up to 30 feet long for six bombs, one bomb per space. The bombs don't directly hit any creatures; instead, creatures take splash damage from the bombs as usual, but combine the splash damage from multiple overlapping bombs together before applying weaknesses or resistances. Apply any effects normally applied to splash damage when throwing a bomb (such as the effects of the Calculated Splash feat).

entries.name: Bonmuan Swapping Stone (Greater)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This small, opalescent stone glows with a light that constantly shifts between colors. When you activate the stone, you throw it into a space within 100 feet. The stone then casts dimension door on you and transports you to itself. This destroys the stone.

You can instead hurl the stone at a creature in an attempt to bring that creature closer to you. Make a ranged Strike against a creature using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. The swapping stone has a range increment of 15 feet. On a hit, the stone shatters against the creature, casting dimension door on the creature and causing it to instantly teleport to a space adjacent to you. An unwilling creature can resist this teleportation with a successful @Check[type:will|dc:37|name:Bonmuan Swapping Stone|traits:teleportation|showDC:owner] save.

entries.name: Bonmuan Swapping Stone (Lesser)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This small, opalescent stone glows with a light that constantly shifts between colors. When you activate the stone, you throw it into a space within 100 feet. The stone then casts dimension door on you and transports you to itself. This destroys the stone.

You can instead hurl the stone at a creature in an attempt to bring that creature closer to you. Make a ranged Strike against a creature using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. The swapping stone has a range increment of 15 feet. On a hit, the stone shatters against the creature, casting dimension door on the creature and causing it to instantly teleport to a space adjacent to you. An unwilling creature can resist this teleportation with a successful @Check[type:will|dc:28|name:Bonmuan Swapping Stone|traits:teleportation|showDC:owner] save.

entries.name: Bonmuan Swapping Stone (Major)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This small, opalescent stone glows with a light that constantly shifts between colors. When you activate the stone, you throw it into a space within 100 feet. The stone then casts dimension door on you and transports you to itself. This destroys the stone.

You can instead hurl the stone at a creature in an attempt to bring that creature closer to you. Make a ranged Strike against a creature using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. The swapping stone has a range increment of 15 feet. On a hit, the stone shatters against the creature, casting dimension door on the creature and causing it to instantly teleport to a space adjacent to you. An unwilling creature can resist this teleportation with a successful @Check[type:will|dc:43|name:Bonmuan Swapping Stone|traits:teleportation|showDC:owner] save.

entries.name: Bonmuan Swapping Stone (Moderate)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This small, opalescent stone glows with a light that constantly shifts between colors. When you activate the stone, you throw it into a space within 100 feet. The stone then casts dimension door on you and transports you to itself. This destroys the stone.

You can instead hurl the stone at a creature in an attempt to bring that creature closer to you. Make a ranged Strike against a creature using your highest proficiency with a ranged weapon. The swapping stone has a range increment of 15 feet. On a hit, the stone shatters against the creature, casting dimension door on the creature and causing it to instantly teleport to a space adjacent to you. An unwilling creature can resist this teleportation with a successful @Check[type:will|dc:31|name:Bonmuan Swapping Stone|traits:teleportation|showDC:owner] save.

entries.name: Book of Lingering Blaze
entries.description:
The common saying, "Where there is progress in the field of magic, there is always someone who uses it to set things on fire," is engraved in gold on the cover of this red spellbook.

Activate 1 envision (metamagic)

Frequency once per day

Effect If your next action is to cast an evocation spell dealing fire damage that you prepared from this grimoire, you superheat the flames, allowing the spell to ignore up to 10 resistance to fire of creatures affected by the spell.

entries.name: Bookthief Brew
entries.description:
Activate 1 minute

This concoction mixes into a thick, paste-like substance when shaken. When exposed to air, the substance dries after one minute. If poured over a book, scroll, or other material featuring words written in ink, the brew will make an exact copy of the words it is in contact with while it dries, though it doesn't contain any magical effect or other special properties of the original words. Once dried, you can remove the dried substance as an Interact action. A single vial of bookthief brew can coat two pages from a book, a single scroll, or a similar amount of area for other surfaces, producing a dried sheet as thick as a piece of paper. Unfortunately, the sheet's copy is flipped, requiring a mirror to properly read.

entries.name: Boom Snare
entries.description:
By combining a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.yd3kEK21YknZLlcT]{Alchemist's Fire (Lesser)}, a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.Xnqglykl3Cif8rN9]{Thunderstone (Lesser)}, and other catalysts with a pressure sensitive trigger, you create a snare that creates a fiery and thunderous explosion when triggered. The target and all creatures in adjacent squares take [[/r {2d6}[fire]+{2d6}[sonic]]]{2d6 fire damage and 2d6 sonic damage} with a basic @Check[type:reflex|dc:19|traits:mechanicle] save. On a failure, they are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds} and take [[/r {1d4}[persistent,fire]]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.lDVqvLKA6eF3Df60]{Persistent Fire Damage}.

Craft Requirements Supply a lesser alchemist's fire and a lesser thunderstone.

entries.name: Boots of Bounding
entries.description:
The springy soles of these sturdy leather boots cushion your feet and make each step lighter. These boots give you a +5-foot item bonus to your Speed and a +2 item bonus to Athletics checks to High Jump and Long Jump.

In addition, when you use the Leap action, you can move 5 feet further if jumping horizontally or 3 feet higher if jumping vertically.

entries.name: Boots of Bounding (Greater)
entries.description:
The springy soles of these sturdy leather boots cushion your feet and make each step lighter. These boots give you a +10-foot item bonus to your Speed and a +3 item bonus to Athletics checks to High Jump and Long Jump.

In addition, when you use the Leap action, you can move 5 feet further if jumping horizontally or 3 feet higher if jumping vertically.

Automatically applied effects:

  • +10-foot item bonus to Speed
  • +3 item bonus to Athletics checks to High Jump and Long Jump

entries.name: Boots of Dancing
entries.description: These boots act as @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.8NgA4PFFXZPZ9SSg]{Boots of Elvenkind (Greater)}, but they react wildly to strong physical exertion. While you wear the boots, the curse activates whenever you attempt an Athletics check or Stride more than once in a single round during an encounter. The boots cast an 8th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Jvyy6oVIQsD34MHB]{Uncontrollable Dance} spell on you, and you automatically fail your save. Once the curse has activated for the first time, the boots fuse to you.

entries.name: Boots of Elvenkind
entries.description:
These tall, pointed boots are made from soft, supple black or green leather and are decorated with trim and buckles of gold. When worn, the boots allow you to move more nimbly, granting you a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks.

Activate F envision

Frequency once per hour

Effect Until the end of your turn, you ignore difficult terrain when moving on the ground. If you're wearing a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.MNBnZn0b80Q7yHJM]{Cloak of Elvenkind}, you also gain a +5-foot status bonus to your land Speed until the end of your turn.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.88kqcDmsoAEddzUt]{Effect: Boots of Elvenkind}

entries.name: Boots of Elvenkind (Greater)
entries.description:
These tall, pointed boots are made from soft, supple black or green leather and are decorated with trim and buckles of gold. When worn, the boots allow you to move more nimbly, granting you a +2 item bonus to Acrobatics checks.

Activate F envision

Frequency once per hour

Effect Until the end of your turn, you ignore difficult terrain when moving on the ground. If you're wearing a @Compendium[pf2e.equipment-srd.MNBnZn0b80Q7yHJM]{Cloak of Elvenkind}, you also gain a +5-foot status bonus to your land Speed until the end of your turn, and greater boots of elvenkind constantly grant the effects of @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.zlnXpME1T2uvn8Lr]{Pass Without Trace} (DC 30) in forest environments.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.88kqcDmsoAEddzUt]{Effect: Boots of Elvenkind}

entries.name: Boots of Speed
entries.description:
These sleek red boots make your legs feel like they're bursting with energy. You gain a +5-foot item bonus to your land Speed and to any climb or swim Speeds you have.

Activate A Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You click the heels of the boots together and gain the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened} condition for 1 minute. You can use the extra action to Stride, Climb, or Swim. (You must still attempt an Athletics check for the Climb and Swim actions unless you have the appropriate movement type.)

entries.name: Bort's Blessing
entries.description:
This ornate copper band has a small ruby set in the center, flanked by a pair of dwarven runes. The wearer of this ring gains the ability to understand, read, and speak one common language of their choice, selected each morning as part of their daily preparations.

In addition, the wearer receives a +1 item bonus to Diplomacy checks to Make an Impression.

entries.name: Bottled Air
entries.description:
Appearing to be an ordinary corked glass bottle, this item contains a limitless supply of fresh air. You must uncork the bottle with an Interact action before you can activate it.

Activate A Interact

Effect You draw a breath of air from the bottle. This allows you to breathe even in an airless or toxic environment. Air doesn't escape the mouth of the bottle, so leaving the open bottle in an airless environment doesn't change the environment.

entries.name: Bottled Lightning (Greater)
entries.description:
Activate A Strike

Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals 3d6 electricity damage and 3 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of your next turn. You gain a +2 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: Bottled Lightning (Lesser)
entries.description:
Activate A Strike

Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals 1d6 electricity damage and 1 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Bottled Lightning (Major)
entries.description:
Activate A Strike

Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals 4d6 electricity damage and 4 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of your next turn. You gain a +3 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: Bottled Lightning (Moderate)
entries.description:
Activate A Strike

Bottled lightning is packed with volatile reagents that create a blast of electricity when they are exposed to air. Bottled lightning deals 2d6 electricity damage and 2 electricity splash damage. On a hit, the target becomes @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} until the start of your next turn. You gain a +1 item bonus to attack rolls.

entries.name: Bottled Sunlight (Greater)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This mirrored bottle contains various chemicals dissolved in two immiscible solvents. Shaking the bottle induces chemical reactions that cause it to glow. For 1 hour, the bottle sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

During this hour, it can be thrown like a bomb. This requires a single action to Activate with a Strike, like other bombs, and deals the damage below. If it's not thrown within an hour of the first activation, it defuses harmlessly and is consumed.

The bomb deals 3d4 positive damage and 3 positive splash damage, as well as 3d4 additional fire damage. As normal, positive damage harms only undead and other creatures with negative healing. Undead with a particular vulnerability to sunlight (such as vampires or wraiths) take the maximum amount of positive damage from bottled sunlight (12 instead of 3d4). For any ability that depends on the number of weapon dice bottled sunlight has, count only the positive damage dice

entries.name: Bottled Sunlight (Lesser)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This mirrored bottle contains various chemicals dissolved in two immiscible solvents. Shaking the bottle induces chemical reactions that cause it to glow. For 1 hour, the bottle sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

During this hour, it can be thrown like a bomb. This requires a single action to Activate with a Strike, like other bombs, and deals the damage below. If it's not thrown within an hour of the first activation, it defuses harmlessly and is consumed.

The bomb deals 1d4 positive damage and 1 positive splash damage, as well as 1d4 additional fire damage. As normal, positive damage harms only undead and other creatures with negative healing. Undead with a particular vulnerability to sunlight (such as vampires or wraiths) take the maximum amount of positive damage from bottled sunlight (1 instead of 1d4). For any ability that depends on the number of weapon dice bottled sunlight has, count only the positive damage dice.

entries.name: Bottled Sunlight (Major)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This mirrored bottle contains various chemicals dissolved in two immiscible solvents. Shaking the bottle induces chemical reactions that cause it to glow. For 1 hour, the bottle sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

During this hour, it can be thrown like a bomb. This requires a single action to Activate with a Strike, like other bombs, and deals the damage below. If it's not thrown within an hour of the first activation, it defuses harmlessly and is consumed.

The bomb deals 4d4 positive damage and 4 positive splash damage, as well as 4d4 additional fire damage. As normal, positive damage harms only undead and other creatures with negative healing. Undead with a particular vulnerability to sunlight (such as vampires or wraiths) take the maximum amount of positive damage from bottled sunlight (16 instead of 4d4). For any ability that depends on the number of weapon dice bottled sunlight has, count only the positive damage dice.

entries.name: Bottled Sunlight (Moderate)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

This mirrored bottle contains various chemicals dissolved in two immiscible solvents. Shaking the bottle induces chemical reactions that cause it to glow. For 1 hour, the bottle sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius (and dim light to the next 40 feet).

During this hour, it can be thrown like a bomb. This requires a single action to Activate with a Strike, like other bombs, and deals the damage below. If it's not thrown within an hour of the first activation, it defuses harmlessly and is consumed.

The bomb deals 2d4 positive damage and 2 positive splash damage, as well as 2d4 additional fire damage. As normal, positive damage harms only undead and other creatures with negative healing. Undead with a particular vulnerability to sunlight (such as vampires or wraiths) take the maximum amount of positive damage from bottled sunlight (2 instead of 2d4). For any ability that depends on the number of weapon dice bottled sunlight has, count only the positive damage dice.

entries.name: Bottomless Stein
entries.description: A magic item regarded as holy by followers of Cayden Cailean, this ornate metallic stein is always filled to the brim with delicious ale, no matter how much is drunk or spilled. If it is emptied (such as by being gulped quickly or upended onto the floor), the bottomless stein will fill again within 1 round as long as it is right side up, though it's impossible to transfer the ale to another container to sell it or store it for later. The exact type of ale with which the stein is filled is determined at the item's creation, and cannot be changed thereafter.

entries.name: Boulderhead Bock
entries.description:
Activate A Interact

No one is sure if Gorm brews this malty ale himself, but it seems to be an off-duty favorite of the Grand Archive faction leader. The brew packs a heavy punch, and while Gorm officially discourages drinking on the job, boulderhead bock does makes the drinker more self-assured and protects them from conditions that would addle their mental faculties.

For 1 hour, you gain a +1 item bonus to saving throws against effects that would make you stunned or stupefied. However, you also become less aware of your surroundings, taking a -2 item penalty to Perception for 1 hour.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.2C1HuKDQDGFZuv7l]{Effect: Boulderhead Bock}

entries.name: Bountiful Cauldron
entries.description:
This mid-sized, silver cauldron is a boon within areas where access to fresh food is limited, for it can be commanded to fill itself with hearty (and delicious) vegetable stew. It can also be put to a much greater use in the pursuit of crafting certain items. When used to Craft alchemical items, potions, or oils, a bountiful cauldron grants a +2 item bonus to the Crafting check.

Activate T command, Interact

Frequency once per day

Effect You stir the cauldron, and it casts a 4th-level @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.Mt6ZzkVX8Q4xigFq]{Create Food} spell, filling itself with enough delicious vegetable stew to feed 12 Medium creatures.

entries.name: Bracelet of Dashing
entries.description:
This jangling, silvery bracelet makes you lighter on your feet, giving you a +1 item bonus to Acrobatics checks.

Activate A command

Frequency once per day

Effect You gain a +10-foot status bonus to Speed for 1 minute.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.lLP56tbG689TNKW5]{Effect: Bracelet of Dashing}

entries.name: Bracers of Armor I
entries.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +1 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

entries.name: Bracers of Armor II
entries.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +2 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

entries.name: Bracers of Armor III
entries.description: These stiff leather armguards grant you a +3 item bonus to AC and saving throws, and a maximum Dexterity modifier of +5. You can affix talismans to bracers of armor as though they were light armor.

entries.name: Bracers of Missile Deflection
entries.description:
These bracers are made from plates of durable mithral and gleam like the summer sun.

Activate R Interact

Frequency once per day

Trigger A ranged weapon attack hits you but doesn't critically hit

Requirements You are aware of the attack and not flat-footed

Effect The bracers send the missile off-course. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this would cause the attack to be a failure, the attack misses you.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.PeiuJ951kkBPTCSM]{Effect: Bracers of Missile Deflection}

entries.name: Bracers of Missile Deflection (Greater)
entries.description:
These bracers are made from plates of durable mithral and gleam like the summer sun.

Activate R Interact

Frequency once every 10 minutes

Trigger A ranged weapon attack hits you but doesn't critically hit

Requirements You are aware of the attack and not flat-footed

Effect The bracers send the missile off-course. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack. If this would cause the attack to be a failure, the attack misses you.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.PeiuJ951kkBPTCSM]{Effect: Bracers of Missile Deflection}

entries.name: Brain Cylinder
entries.description:
Perception +15; vision (precise) 30 feet, hearing (imprecise )30 feet

Communication speech (all languages known in life)

Skills varies

Int +2, Wis +2, Cha +2

AC 21; Fort +10, Ref +8, Will +15

HP 68; Immunities bleed, disease, death effects, paralyzed, poison; Weaknesses bludgeoning 7, sonic 7; Resistances fire 7, piercing 7, slashing 7

A brain cylinder allows the extracted brain of a Large or smaller creature to continue to function even after it has been removed from the body. As long as the brain remains in the cylinder, the creature remains alive and can continue to think, even though its body is dead. Detachable modules that fit into the base of the cylinder allow the brain to see, hear, or speak using a raspy speaker. So long as these are attached, the brain can speak and understand any languages it knew in life, though nothing within the cylinder compels it to do so if it is unwilling. It also retains its living alignment, and can use Intelligence-, Wisdom-, and Charisma-based skills. A standard brain cylinder has one skill at +15, one at +13, and two at +11, as chosen by the GM.

The brain retains no other abilities it possessed in life, including purely mental ones. Mi-go typically preserve humanoid brains in this manner when they wish to interrogate a creature at a later date, or when they wish to preserve a creature as a resource for consultation or research purposes, as a brain preserved in this manner can live for centuries. If a brain cylinder is destroyed, the brain dies and its soul finally moves on to the Boneyard. Restoring a brain in a brain cylinder to its former body can be done by any effect that restores life (and, in most cases, any capable of creating a new body, since the original is typically missing or long gone).

Note that the level 6 brain cylinder presented represents a level 6 creature's brain. A less powerful or more powerful brain can be placed in a brain cylinder, which can affect the brain cylinder's Perception, mental ability scores, Will save, and skill modifiers (and can drastically alter the value of the brain cylinder), but the physical properties of the brain cylinder remain unchanged. Higher-level brain cylinders can be crafted, with resistances and weaknesses increasing as appropriate to their level. However, they always have low AC and HP and terrible Fortitude and Reflex saves for a creature of the brain cylinder's level.

You can open a brain cylinder by taking three consecutive actions with the manipulate trait. If the brain cylinder contains a brain, the brain dies 3 rounds after it's removed or if the cylinder is left open for more than 10 minutes. You can transfer a brain from one brain cylinder to another with a DC 25 Medicine (expert) or Occultism (expert) check. This is a two-action activity with the manipulate trait. On a critical failure, the brain dies.

entries.name: Brass Dragon's Breath Potion (Adult)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a brass dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a brass dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of fire which deals [[/r {6d6}[fire]]]{6d6 fire damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true|name:Adult Brass Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Brass Dragon's Breath Potion (Wyrm)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a brass dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a brass dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of fire which deals [[/r {10d6}[fire]]]{10d6 fire damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true|name:Wyrm Brass Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Brass Dragon's Breath Potion (Young)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a brass dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a brass dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of fire which deals [[/r {4d6}[fire]]]{4d6 fire damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true|name:Young Brass Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Brass Ear
entries.description: A brass ear is a short, flared tube with one end narrow enough to comfortably fit against the ear canal. When using a brass ear to listen through a door, window, thin wall, or similar barrier, if the barrier would normally increase the DC of your Perception check to hear sounds on the other side, the DC increases by only half as much as normal.

entries.name: Bravo's Brew (Greater)
entries.description:
Activate A Interact

This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +3 item bonus to Will saves, or +4 when attempting Will saves against fear. If you roll a success on a save against fear, you get a critical success instead.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.q1EhQ716bPSgJVnC]{Effect: Bravo's Brew (Greater)}

entries.name: Bravo's Brew (Lesser)
entries.description:
Activate A Interact

This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +1 item bonus to Will saves, or +2 when attempting Will saves against fear.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.eh7EqmDBDW30ShCu]{Effect: Bravo's Brew (Lesser)}

entries.name: Bravo's Brew (Moderate)
entries.description:
Activate A Interact

This flask of foaming beer grants courage. For the next hour after drinking this elixir, you gain a +2 item bonus to Will saves, or +3 when attempting Will saves against fear.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.wTZnKkT0K4Tdy8mD]{Effect: Bravo's Brew (Moderate)}

entries.name: Breastplate
entries.description: Though referred to as a breastplate, this type of armor consists of several pieces of plate or half‑plate armor that protect the torso, chest, neck, and sometimes the hips and lower legs. It strategically grants some of the protection of plate while allowing greater flexibility and speed.

entries.name: Breastplate of Command
entries.description:
This +1 resilient breastplate is made from shining bronze overlaid with reinforcing golden panels in the shape of lion's heads. Wearing this breastplate grants you a commanding aura. You gain a +2 item bonus to Diplomacy checks, but you take a -2 item penalty to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak and Deception checks to Impersonate.

ActivateACommand

Frequency once per day

Effect You grant allies within 100 feet a +2 status bonus to saves against fear effects for 1 minute. When you activate this ability, each affected ally who's frightened reduces their frightened value by 1.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.G0lG7IIZnCZtYi6v]{Effect: Breastplate of Command}

entries.name: Breastplate of Command (Greater)
entries.description:
This +2 greater resilient breastplate is made from shining bronze overlaid with reinforcing golden panels in the shape of lion's heads. Wearing this breastplate grants you a commanding aura. You gain a +3 item bonus to Diplomacy checks, but you take a -3 item penalty to Stealth checks to Hide and Sneak and Deception checks to Impersonate.

ActivateACommand

Frequency once per day

Effect You grant allies within 100 feet a +2 status bonus to saves against fear effects for 1 minute. When you activate this ability, each affected ally who's frightened reduces their frightened value by 1.

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.G0lG7IIZnCZtYi6v]{Effect: Breastplate of Command}

entries.name: Breath Blaster
entries.description:
A breath blaster is a +1 striking blunderbuss most commonly crafted from the trachea of a dragon, though other creatures with breath weapons or the ability to spit energy are occasionally used. The implementation of the dragon's trachea allows the firearm to unleash a torrent of pure energy in the form of gouts of flame or bolts of electricity.

A breath blaster's Strikes deal either acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage, depending on the dragon type or other creature from which it was made, though it can otherwise be used like a normal blunderbuss. A breath blaster also can be activated to fire a line of energy in a @Template[type:line|distance:30] or @Template[type:cone|distance:15], chosen when it's created and typically corresponding to the shape of the breath weapon used by the type of dragon or creature from which the breath blaster was created.

In theory, the foundational techniques required to create a breath blaster would allow for other damage types, but such breath blasters would require the trachea from the correct dragon or creature type and additional creation techniques, making such a breath blaster rare rather than uncommon.

Activate 2 Interact (evocation, magical)

Frequency once per minute

Effect You fire the breath blaster, dealing [[/r 4d6]] damage of the appropriate type in the appropriate area. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:24|basic:true|traits:evocation,magical|showDC:owner] save (or @Check[type:fortitude|dc:24|traits:evocation,magical|showDC:owner] save if the damage is poison).

Craft Requirements The initial raw materials must include the trachea of a ritually hunted dragon or other creature with a breath weapon with the appropriate damage type and area (line or cone) for the breath blaster.

entries.name: Breath Blaster (Greater)
entries.description:
A greater breath blaster is a +2 greater striking blunderbuss most commonly crafted from the trachea of a dragon, though other creatures with breath weapons or the ability to spit energy are occasionally used. The implementation of the dragon's trachea allows the firearm to unleash a torrent of pure energy in the form of gouts of flame or bolts of electricity.

A breath blaster's Strikes deal either acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage, depending on the dragon type or other creature from which it was made, though it can otherwise be used like a normal blunderbuss. A breath blaster also can be activated to fire a line of energy in a @Template[type:line|distance:30] or @Template[type:cone|distance:15], chosen when it's created and typically corresponding to the shape of the breath weapon used by the type of dragon or creature from which the breath blaster was created.

In theory, the foundational techniques required to create a breath blaster would allow for other damage types, but such breath blasters would require the trachea from the correct dragon or creature type and additional creation techniques, making such a breath blaster rare rather than uncommon.

Activate 1 Interact (evocation, magical)

Frequency once per minute

Effect You fire the breath blaster, dealing [[/r 6d6]] damage of the appropriate type in the appropriate area. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:31|basic:true|name:Breath Blaster|traits:evocation,magical|showDC:owner] save (or @Check[type:fortitude|dc:31|name:Breath Blaster|traits:evocation,magical|showDC:owner] save if the damage is poison).

Craft Requirements The initial raw materials must include the trachea of a ritually hunted dragon or other creature with a breath weapon with the appropriate damage type and area (line or cone) for the breath blaster.

entries.name: Breath Blaster (Major)
entries.description:
A major breath blaster is a +3 major striking blunderbuss most commonly crafted from the trachea of a dragon, though other creatures with breath weapons or the ability to spit energy are occasionally used. The implementation of the dragon's trachea allows the firearm to unleash a torrent of pure energy in the form of gouts of flame or bolts of electricity.

A breath blaster's Strikes deal either acid, cold, electricity, fire, or poison damage, depending on the dragon type or other creature from which it was made, though it can otherwise be used like a normal blunderbuss. A breath blaster also can be activated to fire a line of energy in a @Template[type:line|distance:30] or @Template[type:cone|distance:15], chosen when it's created and typically corresponding to the shape of the breath weapon used by the type of dragon or creature from which the breath blaster was created.

In theory, the foundational techniques required to create a breath blaster would allow for other damage types, but such breath blasters would require the trachea from the correct dragon or creature type and additional creation techniques, making such a breath blaster rare rather than uncommon.

Activate 1 Interact (evocation, magical)

Frequency once per minute

Effect You fire the breath blaster, dealing [[/r 10d6]] damage of the appropriate type in the appropriate area. Creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:38|basic:true|name:Breath Blaster|traits:evocation,magical|showDC:owner] save (or @Check[type:fortitude|dc:38|name:Breath Blaster|traits:evocation,magical|showDC:owner] save if the damage is poison).

Craft Requirements The initial raw materials must include the trachea of a ritually hunted dragon or other creature with a breath weapon with the appropriate damage type and area (line or cone) for the breath blaster.

entries.name: Breech Ejectors
entries.description: These spring-loaded inserts can be fitted into the breech of a double-barreled firearm over the course of 10 minutes or during the firearm's daily maintenance. After the weapon is fired, the ejectors hasten the reloading process by ejecting the spent detritus from the fired rounds. This allows you to reload both barrels of the double-barreled weapon as a single Interact action the next time you reload the weapon as long as you do so before the end of your next turn. However, the ejectors are consumed in the process, and you must spend the time to insert a new set to gain the benefit again.

entries.name: Brewer's Regret
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

When a brewer makes a batch of something they'd rather not drink, they often boil it down; add myrrh, mugwort extract, and violet salt; and sell it to chefs looking for cheap sandwich fillings. The thick, salty sourness ruins the taste of most other food, but it also creates a strong desire to live to taste anything else. For 1 hour after consumption, you gain a +2 item bonus to saves against death and negative effects. In addition, your doomed value decreases by 1 (minimum 0). You can reduce the doomed condition with brewer's regret only once per day, and after you do, you can't reduce the doomed condition from the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.SnaLVgxZ9ryUFmUr]{Restoration} spell that same day (or vice versa).

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.9e6iVkPpGqJYwMyb]{Effect: Brewer's Regret}

entries.name: Brewer's Regret (Greater)
entries.description:
Activate 1 Interact

When a brewer makes a batch of something they'd rather not drink, they often boil it down; add myrrh, mugwort extract, and violet salt; and sell it to chefs looking for cheap sandwich fillings. The thick, salty sourness ruins the taste of most other food, but it also creates a strong desire to live to taste anything else. For 1 hour after consumption, you gain a +3 item bonus to saves against death and negative effects. In addition, your doomed value decreases by 1 (minimum 0). You can reduce the doomed condition with brewer's regret only once per day, and after you do, you can't reduce the doomed condition from the @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.SnaLVgxZ9ryUFmUr]{Restoration} spell that same day (or vice versa).

@Compendium[pf2e.equipment-effects.Ja3PlqLuD9aSaPNZ]{Effect: Brewer's Regret (Greater)}

entries.name: Brilliant
entries.description:
This rune causes a weapon to transform into pure, brilliant energy. The weapon deals an additional [[/r {1d4}[fire]]]{1d4 fire damage} on a successful Strike, as well as [[/r {1d4}[good]]]{1d4 good damage} to fiends and [[/r {1d4}[positive]]]{1d4 positive damage} to undead.

On a critical hit, the target must succeed at a DC 29 Fortitude save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Activate 1 command (light)

Effect You plunge your weapon into darkness to return the light. Attempt a counteract check with a counteract level of 5 and a +19 counteract modifier to end a magical darkness effect whose area is within reach of the weapon.

entries.name: Brilliant (Greater)
entries.description:
This rune causes a weapon to transform into pure, brilliant energy. The weapon deals an additional [[/r {1d4}[fire]]]{1d4 fire damage} on a successful Strike, as well as [[/r {1d4}[good]]]{1d4 good damage} to fiends and [[/r {1d4}[positive]]]{1d4 positive damage} to undead. Damage dealt by this weapon ignores the target's fire, good, or positive resistance.

On a critical hit, the target must succeed at a DC 41 Fortitude save or be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} for 1 round.

Activate 1 command (light)

Effect You plunge your weapon into darkness to return the light. Attempt a counteract check with a counteract level of 9 and a +31 counteract modifier to end a magical darkness effect whose area is within reach of the weapon.

entries.name: Brilliant Rapier
entries.description: This +2 brilliant greater striking rapier is formed entirely out of radiant energy, even more so than a usual brilliant weapon, and has left its physical form behind entirely. Instead of dealing piercing damage, it deals fire damage, and in addition to a rapier's normal weapon traits, it gains the versatile good or positive trait.

entries.name: Brimstone Fumes
entries.description:
Fumes from the forges of Hell drain health and strength alike.

Activate A Interact (Inhaled)

Saving Throw @Check[type:fortitude|dc:36]

Onset 1 round

Maximum Duration 6 rounds

Stage 1 [[/r {7d6}[poison]]]{7d6 poison damage} and @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 [[/r {8d6}[poison]]]{8d6 poison damage} and enfeebled 2 (1 round)

Stage 3 [[/r {10d6}[poison]]]{10d6 poison damage} and enfeebled 3 (1 round)

entries.name: Broken Tusk Pendant
entries.description:
The followers of the Broken Tusk have passed down their custom of crafting and gifting these small ivory necklaces for generations. They're typically made from mammoth tusk (though any type of ivory will do), and each is carved to resemble a particular kind of animal-usually a raven, a moose, an ox, or an otter. Because tradition dictates that Broken Tusk followers take ivory only from already-dead animals, Broken Tusk pendants are especially rare; if an individual loses their pendant, it might be years before they acquire the materials necessary to fashion a replacement. Broken Tusk pendants bear no magical powers if they are made for oneself; only gifted pendants have true magical properties.

You wear a Broken Tusk pendant like jewelry or tie it to your clothing. A Broken Tusk pendant grants you a +1 item bonus to Nature checks; this bonus increases to +2 when you Command an Animal of the specific kind depicted by the pendant.

Activate R Interact;

Frequency once per hour

Trigger An animal targets you with a melee attack, and you can see the animal

Effect You gain a +1 item bonus to AC against the triggering attack, or a +2 item bonus if the animal is the specific kind depicted by the pendant.

entries.name: Broken Tusk Pendant (Greater)
entries.description:
The followers of the Broken Tusk have passed down their custom of crafting and gifting these small ivory necklaces for generations. They're typically made from mammoth tusk (though any type of ivory will do), and each is carved to resemble a particular kind of animal-usually a raven, a moose, an ox, or an otter. Because tradition dictates that Broken Tusk followers take ivory only from already-dead animals, Broken Tusk pendants are especially rare; if an individual loses their pendant, it might be years before they acquire the materials necessary to fashion a replacement. Broken Tusk pendants bear no magical powers if they are made for oneself; only gifted pendants have true magical properties.

You wear a Broken Tusk pendant like jewelry or tie it to your clothing. A Broken Tusk pendant grants you a +2 item bonus to Nature checks; this bonus increases to +3 when you Command an Animal of the specific kind depicted by the pendant.

Activate R Interact;

Frequency once per hour

Trigger An animal targets you with a melee attack, and you can see the animal

Effect You gain a +1 item bonus to AC against the triggering attack, or a +2 item bonus if the animal is the specific kind depicted by the pendant.

Once per day, when you use the Broken Tusk pendant's activation, if the animal misses you, the Broken Tusk pendant casts @Compendium[pf2e.spells-srd.OsOhx3TGIZ7AhD0P]{Dominate} on the animal (@Check[type:will|dc:30|name:Dominate|traits:enchantment,incapacitation,primal,mental|overrideTraits:true]). You can choose whether to use this once-per-day effect after the animal misses you.

entries.name: Bronze Bull Pendant
entries.description:
Usage affixed to armor

Activate F Envision

Trigger You attempt an Athletics check to Shove, but you haven't rolled yet

Requirements You are trained in Athletics

This pendant is forged from grainy steel and depicts a snorting bull's face. The pendant must be attached to the chest area or on a shoulder guard.

When you activate the pendant, you gain a +2 status bonus to the Athletics check to Shove, and if you roll a critical failure on the check, you get a failure instead.

@Compendium[pf2e.consumable-effects.Cxa7MdgMCUoMqbKm]{Effect: Bronze Bull Pendant}

entries.name: Bronze Dragon's Breath Potion (Adult)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a bronze dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a bronze dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of electricity which deals [[/r {6d6}[electricity]]]{6d6 electricity damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:29|basic:true|name:Adult Bronze Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Bronze Dragon's Breath Potion (Wyrm)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a bronze dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a bronze dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of electricity which deals [[/r {10d6}[electricity]]]{10d6 electricity damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:37|basic:true|name:Wyrm Bronze Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Bronze Dragon's Breath Potion (Young)
entries.description:
This liquid contains blood from a bronze dragon. For 1 hour after you imbibe the concoction, you can unleash a bronze dragon's breath weapon. The potency of the breath depends on the potion's type, based on the age of the dragon whose blood was used to make the potion.

Exhaling dragon breath uses a single action. You create a @Template[type:line|distance:30] of electricity which deals [[/r {4d6}[electricity]]]{4d6 electricity damage}. All creatures in the area must attempt a @Check[type:reflex|dc:23|basic:true|name:Young Bronze Dragon's Breath Potion] save.

After you use the breath weapon, you can't do so again for [[/r 1d4 #rounds]]{1d4 rounds}.

entries.name: Brooch of Inspiration
entries.description:
This finely cut garnet brooch fills your mind with vigor and occasional bursts of mental clarity. While wearing the brooch, you gain a +1 item bonus to checks to Recall Knowledge with Lore skills.

Activate 2 envision (fortune)

Frequency once per day

Effect You think hard on a topic and receive a sudden inspiration. You attempt to Recall Knowledge using Lore. On this check, you roll twice and take the higher result.

entries.name: Brooch of Inspiration (Greater)
entries.description:
This finely cut garnet brooch fills your mind with vigor and occasional bursts of mental clarity. While wearing the brooch, you gain a +2 item bonus to checks to Recall Knowledge with Lore skills.

Activate 2 envision (fortune)

Frequency once per hour

Effect You think hard on a topic and receive a sudden inspiration. You attempt to Recall Knowledge using Lore. On this check, you roll twice and take the higher result.

entries.name: Brooch of Inspiration (Major)
entries.description:
